name: Idiopathic Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (MCAS) with Angioedema
chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of facial swelling, hives, and dizziness after eating unfamiliar foods

lab_results.Serum tryptase: Normal baseline (5 ng/mL) with 225% increase during flare

prognosis: Chronic condition requiring lifelong management; 30% develop progressive systemic involvement
description: A non-clonal mast cell disorder characterized by recurrent, severe idiopathic activation episodes with mediator release. Differs from mastocytosis by absence of mast cell proliferation. Pathogenesis involves aberrant IgE-independent mast cell signaling thresholds.
